alert.note: Alert for Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 8:31PM MDT until June 28 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL YELLOWSTONE COUNTY... At 831 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain just north of Shepherd and Worden over Razor Creek and Pompeys Pillar Creek. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Water may be slow to recede from low-lying areas due to saturated soils. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Worden, Ballantine, Shepherd and Pompeys Pillar. This warning does not include the city of Billings. Be alert for washed out rural roads. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
